data.title: Error message tweak when no task exists for preLaunch
data.body:
Testing: #2940 

I have a preLaunch task set up without a gulpfile or task.json.  Press F5 and I get this error message:

"Prelaunch task build terminated with exit code 1." with "Debug Anyway" and "Close" prompts.

Similar to #3437 I suggest we tweak the message and the prompts to be consistent: 
- add "The" so we don't start the message with a lowercase property name
- change "Prelaunch" to "preLaunch" to match the property name
- add single quotes around the task name

> Message: "**The preLaunch** task **'**build**'** terminated with exit code 1.
- Change the prompts to be consistent with #3437:

> Prompts: "Continue" | "Stop"

data.title: Improve preLaunch task error message and prompts
data.body:
Testing #2940 
- I had one error detected with my `less` task, but the message used the plural "Errors". If we don't know if there are 1 or more errors, we can use the term "Error(s)"
- `prelaunch` is all lowercase but the name is really `preLaunch`
- I don't like the phrase "Debug Anyway" and "Close" says to me "close this message". I suggest change the options to "Continue" and "Stop", which are short for "Continue Debugging" and "Stop Debugging".

Message: **Error(s)** detected while running **preLaunch** task '_taskname_'.     

Prompts: **Continue** | **Stop**

data.title: Opening settings.json adds permanent warnings to status bar.
data.body:
After opening the user preferences (Command-comma on Mac), the status bar shows three warnings in the status bar:

![screen shot 2016-02-24 at 4 33 47 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/540554/13305994/938ba136-db14-11e5-8e5d-189cdfd197ff.png)

These warnings persist even after closing the settings.

data.title: Extension [install] Version not Working
data.body:
#2894

I created a new extension and published several versions:
0.0.3 engine = ^0.10.11
0.0.3 engine = ^0.10.11

data.title: Have to reload vscode in order to pick up jsconfig.json
data.body:
Testing #3170 

I still need to reload the environment when i add a jsconfig.json file, even with Salsa.  

add `greeter.js`:

``` javascript
export function greetMe() {
   return 'hello';
}
```

add `app.js`:

``` javascript
var g = require('./greeter');
g.
```

result no intellisense on greeter.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13304395/332b3014-db09-11e5-8707-e2e57f94f21e.png)

add a `jsconfig.json`:

``` javascript
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "commonjs"
    }
}
```
- go back to `app.js`, try to bring up intellisense on `g` again, same result -> no intellisense.
- reload window
- open `app.js`, now we have intellisense:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13304409/49c871ba-db09-11e5-88f4-e613a1b5343a.png)

data.title: Files explorer : *Properties* command in the context menu

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
How about a _Properties_ item / command in the file explorer ? 
I often want to look at my files properties, mainly the size.
If this is not possible, maybe just add a tooltip to show some useful properties.

data.title: JSDoc @constructor shows up in IntelliSense
data.body:
related to #3186?

Testing #3170 and the `@ constructor` JSDoc comment text shows up in the IntelliSense prompt. 

``` javascript
/**
 * Represents a person
 * @constructor
 * @param {string} name The name of the person
 * @param {number} age The age of the person
 */
function Person(name, age) {
    this.name = name;
    this.age = age;
}
var p = new Person
```

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13303539/e652f9e2-db04-11e5-9ce8-beff0eda5216.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/13303493/a0b9951c-db04-11e5-8a87-305d4aba60a8.png)

data.title: Command-E on Mac behaves differently from other applications
data.body: In most Mac applications, pressing Command-E fills the find buffer with the currently selected text. However, in Visual Studio Code, it appears to invoke the Quick Open menu.

data.title: Improve JavaScript language service prompt
data.body:
Testing #3170 

I have the same issue with the JavaScript infrastructure message as with the OmniSharp extension prompt (#2748). It is easy to miss this prompt and I have to be in the mood to want to read the release notes.

Suggest a similar behavior in #2748:

Message: "Our JavaScript support has been enhanced, would you like to view the Release Notes?"

Options:
- **Yes**: Open release notes, set flag to never show prompt again
- **No**: Do not open release notes, set flag to never show prompt again
- **Later**: Do not open release notes, show message next time we open a workspace with JavaScript artifacts

If I press Cmd+Q or ESC we should not set the flag. It should only be set if I choose Yes or No.

data.title: [themes] Themes don't support background styling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
.tmTheme files allow specification of background colors which don't seem to be supported, for example:

``` xml
<dict>
  <key>name</key>
  <string>Separator</string>
  <key>scope</key>
  <string>meta.separator</string>
  <key>settings</key>
  <dict>
    <key>background</key>
    <string>#E0E0E0</string>
    <key>foreground</key>
    <string>#373B41</string>
  </dict>
</dict>
```

This is especially problematic for themes that attempt to invert background and use a similar foreground to the text view's background color (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2158)

data.title: --allowUnreachableCode in tsconfig.json breaks in editor
data.body: I upgraded to 1.8.2. My VScode starting getting red underlines all over after I added the allowUnreachableCode option in the tsconfig. If I remove and restart, it works fine.

data.title: change ms-vscode.omnisharp to ms-vscode.csharp
data.body:
(from testing #2701)

@DustinCampbell is going to rename the extension `ms-vscode.csharp`. 
- `extensionAssistant.ts`, line 57: `extensionChecker['ms-vscode.omnisharp'] = omnisharpChecker;`

it might make sense to change the method name too, from `omnisharpChecker` to `cSharpChecker`.
- `extensionTips.json`, line 2: `"ms-vscode.omnisharp": "{**/*.cs,**/project.json,**/global.json,**/*.csproj,**/*.sln}",`

data.title: tasks.json seeming to cause weird error
[folding] Incorrect indent level being folded
404 when publishing an extension
data.body:
Copied from internal email. 

I'm trying to publish a Visual Studio Code extension. I followed the [steps in the docs](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/tools/vscecli) but, after running vsce publish, I get the following error:

`Error: Failed Request: Bad Request(400) - TF400898: An Internal Error Occurred. Activity Id: 587a31af-2cd4-40ae-bed1-acd5c03723a4.`

data.title: Git out of sync on mounted drive
data.body:
When I attempt to load a project located on a drive mounted via smb:// the git tab in VS Code reports that all files in the project as "changed". When I go to the command line, my Git status command shows the working directory as clean. I have attempted to refresh the git status and it shows the spinner for 10 seconds, but then no changes appear in the Git tab. It just shows 99+ files changed, when in reality, nothing has. 

Perhaps this is user error and I am missing something?

data.title: [folding] language-aware folding

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The current implementation of folding uses an indentation based folding strategy that is unaware of the language it works on. Knowledge on the underlying language allows us to solve the following requests:
- [folding] Cannot code fold empty functions #3349 
- [folding] Collapse ending brace to the same line #3352 
- [folding] Folded block comments should show */ #3350 
- [folding] should not fold whitespace after function #3353 
- [folding] Add code folding for markdown based on heading level #3347
- [folding] [lua] Weird code folding with Lua #3602 
- [folding] Collapse code block ignore comments inside this block #3957
- [folding] Code Folding: support golang multiline strings #5994
- [folding] Optionally fold chained method calls #6991

data.title: Users do not know how to get the menu bar back
data.body:
I see too many tweets like this one:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13289923/07e7da66-db12-11e5-8863-c0eac24da785.png)

We should provide some guidance when the menu bar is hidden on how to get it back, e.g., show a once message.

data.title: Extension Development Host not activating development extension
data.body: I created brand new extension project using `yo code` which has the default activation message in it. When I press `F5` it loads the extension development host but I do not get the activation message. I also put breakpoints on the `activate` method to see if it even gets in there and it doesn't. Is this a configuration error or something with the debugger?

data.title: File types associated with VS Code are all given the same label in File Explorer
data.body: If I associate a file with VS Code (e.g. *.css, *.html, *.js, *.gitignore), each of these files are given the same file type label "Visual Studio Code". Therefore, when viewing a project directory in File Explorer, it is not possible to list files by type, because they all have the same label.

data.title: Add functionality for autoclosing single quotes and double quotes
data.body: I have editor.autoClosingBrackets set to true but it seems it works stricly with brackets. I guess autoclosing single/double quotes is not implemented yet? If not, please do it. I think it is a common feature for every editor.

data.title: The reload Typescript action also applies to JavaScript
data.body:
Now that the TS server powers both TypeScript and JavaScript the action to reload a project also applies to JavaScript:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13287918/b8ecab9c-db09-11e5-84e3-9afcab05368d.png)

I suggest to either rename the action to `Reload TypeScript/JavaScript Project' or we provide a separate action: 'JavaScript: Relead Project'

data.title: Polish task snippets
data.body:
Related to #3159 #3413

As discussed in triage, I reverted commits 8004d27, b7e9c82 and a7a0f82 which introduced snippet support for `tasks.json`. The reverts are: 9d64fe7, 9c5cefb and 856fb0b.

The experience needs to be improved, the user needs more guidance towards creating a final, working `tasks.json` file.

> Joao Moreno [15:08]:
> hi Erich?
> Erich Gamma [15:08]:
> hi
> Joao Moreno [15:08]:
> sorry to bug you
> Erich Gamma [15:08]:
> no prob
> i'm working anyways
> Joao Moreno [15:09]:
> i have a feeling Dirk left his task stuff halfway done: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3159
> it's very hard now to generate a tasks file. I even went through our documentation and couldn't figure it out
> meaning: I tried setting up a build task with the ts compiler, and still didn't make it. maybe this needs more thought?
> Erich Gamma [15:11]:
> This definitely came in hot. I have never used it end to end and only looked at the point feature, which made sense.
> Joao Moreno [15:11]:
> got it
> Erich Gamma [15:11]:
> Let me give it a try as well
> Joao Moreno [15:12]:
> please do. if you feel the same, I propose to undo it and polish it when dirk is back
> Erich Gamma [15:12]:
> agreed, I'll get back to you
> Joao Moreno [15:12]:
> thanks!
> Erich Gamma [15:31]:
> Tried and I got it to work, but there are issues and I suggest to rollback and revisit the experience.
> I'll file an issue
> unless there already is one
> Joao Moreno [15:34]:
> there isn't one for rolling back, no
> just small ones for the isolated hickups in the experience
> Erich Gamma [15:36]:
> ok, then this is good enough and I suggest that you discuss this in the triage and suggest to roll back the change, since Dirk cannot address the hickups and you have my support for this.
> Joao Moreno [15:36]:
> thanks!

data.title: JavaScript snippets don't work in JavaScript React
data.body:
When I type for example "fun" and press tab I expect to see

``` js
function name(params) {

}
```

but I see

``` html
<fun></fun>
```

instead.

data.title: extension install shows non-applicable versions
data.body:
Testing #3244, I published a version for a future version of VSCode.
- ext install shows the future version even if it won't be able to install it
- show outdated show the future version even it won't be able to update to it. When trying to do so it seems as if the update really happens.
  -> would be better to at least give a message that the update failed

The best solution would be if such future versions don't even show up. That way we could put future version in the store without distracting the user on the current version.

data.title: Shift tab should only outdent when at the beginning of the line
data.body:
When pressing <kbd>Shift Tab</kbd> with the cursor in the following position, the editor outdents the line. It felt a bit weird when it happened to me. It should be a no-op.

```
    some code | <- cursor
```
